Posts.Content: On 9/5/2009 JanieK wrote: I too, like so many of you, after taking Aromasin for 2 years, find that the side effects are intolerable and have stopped taking it.  The depressed mood, the restlessness and feelings of rage were getting to be too much for me and it was beginning to effect my relationship with family members.  I knew it was happening, but had little success with trying to control it on my own.  I thought that it was just from the trauma of the whole cancer experience and perhaps long term effects of chemotherapy.  I was Dx'd with Stage III, estrogen positive breast cancer and did the usual chemo, radiation, bi-lateral mastectomy.  For reconstruction I chose a TRAM flap on the tumor side and implantation on the non-cancer side.  This decision has worked very well for me and I'm extremenely pleased.  It's just the dang Aromasin.  I can't stand the pain anymore...I  am 61 and feel 101 !  The depression became unbearable and about 2 weeks ago I decided to chuck the pills.  The depression cleared up within 2 days and it's so awesome to feel more like myself again.  The joint pain, that has just about crippled my hands has not improved at all, but the foot and ankle pain has mostly vanished !  I'm really afraid to tell my oncologist that I've taken myself off of Aromasin, because he's pretty much in denial of my symptoms and wants to blame it on age.  I'm very athletic and one of my passions is hiking, and I mean, hard hikes.  I'm no whimp and can't believe that this joint pain and constant sweating is caused by aging alone.  My husband and I have been searching everywhere to uncover reliable evidence, based on research, what the chances are of the CA recurring if I don't finish out the 5 years (3 more to go) of Aromasin therapy.  Is there anyone out there that can point us to reliable, research based information ?        JanieK  I do not have an answer as I am searching myself for reliable information. I just wanted to say Thank you for your letter that makes me feel as if I have NOT lost my mind and that the pain and swelling that I am experiencing is not in my head and is not just due to my age (65). I also have been a very active person and had some arthritis in my knees but could always exercise and walk forever.  Now however I feel so crippled (even tho I force myself to keep moving) and I too feel like an old woman. I took Tomaxafen for 2 years and had a small amount of pain but I have been on Aromasin for 6 months and I am ready to stop the medication. I will keep checking to see if we find out any new information. Thank you again ! Jeannie
